customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Little Camera....
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a birthday present for my wife as her Canon lasted 3 months before giving up with a lens error. Apparently it is a usual complaint that Canon refuse to deal with or even honour their guarantee. I am a long time Olympus buyer/user and trust their good name and excellent lens optical quality. The functions on this camera are brilliant and everything can be fully controlled from an Android smartphone. We both own DSLRs but usually have a 'carry everywhere' pocket superzoom camera. I have a 6 year old Fujifilm F300EXR (the only other camera name I trust) but if I ever need to upgrade then I will buy one of these for myself.

customer_reviews.title: Surprizingly Awesome!!

customer_reviews.title: 5-axis image stabilization system is disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to get this camera. But after using it, I must say that the 5-axis image stabilization system is very disappointing. I hate taking blurry pictures and after watching the videos on the company's website, I thought those days would be over. That didn't happen. I should had been suspicious when normally there would be a hands on reviews before the official release. I wasn't able to find one anywhere. These picture was just my dog sitting around. In fact, I didn't take any action shots. These were basic still shots. My old Canon G12 took better picture with less blur. For now on, I sticking to Canon and no more Olympus for me.

customer_reviews.title: Don't be surprised by your cameras manufacturing demise

Every photo had a shade of pink on top of the fact the 5 axis mechanics we so poorly made you could see the inside of the zoom lens and no even what your facing. Came broken, I returned it... And spent my 400$ on another digital camera locally. Trust me I bet this camera is great but ya know, not for everybody because Olympus obviously can't let EVERYBODY have a functioning camera.

product_meta.title: Olympus SH-1 16 MP Digital Camera (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Advanced Movie mode (high-speed movies & photo in movie capture)

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



ELEGANCE IN MOTION
A sleek, premium design inspired by classic Olympus PEN cameras. Advanced technology adapted from the award-winning OM-D series. And the first-ever 5-axis image stabilization system for both video and stills in a compact camera. Though conveniently small in size, the new SH-1 looms large, offering an unsurpassed array of technical features: 24x wide angle optical zoom (25-600mm equivalent); built-in WiFi; robust video recording capabilities (including a new Time-Lapse Movie feature); FAST AF technology; and a variety of creative control options.

Sharper Stills and Video with 5-axis IS
Olympus has incorporated its most sophisticated image stabilization technology into the SH-1 – the world’s first* compact camera with 5-axis IS for still photographs as well as video (the IS performance of the SH-1 in video mode is superior to that of a digital camcorder). Enjoy the sharpness of blur-free images whether you’re using the 24x zoom to zero in on wildlife or shooting movies of your kids out on the soccer pitch. *As of March 31, 2014; based on Olympus research

The Smarter, Connected Compact
The SH-1 is designed to fit seamlessly into your digital lifestyle. WiFi is built right into the camera; with the Olympus Image Share app on your smart device, you can share your latest creative endeavors by simply pressing a button. You can also use your device to control the camera remotely – zoom in and out, select shooting and drive modes, adjust exposure and autofocus, trip the shutter – which is handy for group shots and “sneaking up” on wildlife. You can even geotag your photos with location information using the app and your device’s GPS.





Advanced Video Capabilities
With the SH-1, you’ll no longer need to carry around a camcorder! This camera shoots Full HD 60p video for smoother action sequences, as well as high-speed footage (120 fps in HD) that you can replay in slow motion for very cool effects. The Photo & Movie Capture feature allows you to simultaneously freeze action in full-res still photos while recording HD video. And with Time-Lapse Movie, you can compress up to five hours of action into a 20-second movie.





Sophisticated AF Features and Interval Shooting
Getting sharp images of moving subjects is no problem thanks to the SH-1’s touch-screen shutter operation, super high-speed FAST AF technology and ability to fire off up to 11 frames per second in full resolution. Interval Shooting is another tool for channeling your creativity; you can select any number of frames from 1 to 99, establish intervals from 10 seconds to an hour and set the timer at up to 60 minutes – great for changing weather, flower blooming and other fixed-point observations of movement.

Go Old School with Manual Controls
The many automatic features of the SH-1 make it easy to take great photos and video. But sometimes you want to take matters into your own hands and apply your knowledge of just how a camera works. The SH-1’s Manual Exposure mode lets you do just that; you can customize ISO, shutter speed and aperture settings to achieve the specific effects you envision, and check out the results on the LCD monitor before you snap the shutter. You can also use Live Guide to adjust color and brightness on the fly.

Olympus iHS Technology – Intelligent High Speed
All the bells and whistles in the world don’t matter if a camera doesn’t have the right “guts.” The SH-1 most definitely does, sporting Olympus’s best-in-class 16-megapixel BSI CMOS sensor and the same TruePic VII image processor found on the acclaimed OM-D series cameras. This killer combo powers the camera’s enhanced Intelligent Auto – which recognizes subject matter and chooses the right settings almost instantaneously – and high-speed autofocus, enabling you to get the shots you want, when you want them.

The Photos Are Only the Beginning
Clear, sharp, colorful images are great – but sometimes you want to mess around with them a little bit. The SH-1 makes doing so easy thanks to eleven in-camera Art Filters that you can apply for effects like Pin Hole, Grainy Film and Soft Focus – no computer required! Another creative tool is Photo Story, which allows you to create a multi-perspective narrative within a single image – for example, an establishing shot and several close-ups; multiple templates are available for you to experiment with.
